title: Can I call the police on my neighbors because they play music too loudly at night? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, you can call the police, but whether the police do anything about your neighbour’s music depends upon: Whether the police are responsible for enforcing the local noise bylaw (for example, that responsibility might belong to a city by-law officer);Whether the police (assuming they are in fact responsible for enforcing the noise bylaw) actually have resources available to investigate your complaint, relative to their other calls that night; andWhether your neighbour is actually in violation of the relevant noise bylaw. This may depend upon the time of day/night and day of the work, plus the noise level of the music (as measured in decibels) relative to the limits imposed in the noise bylaw.

Of course. It may or may not result in your neighbor lowering their music. The LASD will ask your neighbor to lower the music, assuming they answer the door. If they refuse to open the door or won’t turn the music down, department policy will require you, the caller, to make a “private person’s arrest” (aka “citizens arrest”, though you don’t have to be a citizens to make one, and why it’s really called “private person’s” arrest instead). This means you won’t be able to “remain anonymous” as most callers do. Just something to consider. Other agencies may or may not have similar policies that forbid their officers from being the “victim” of loud music from a residence.

Yes, of course…however, I am a firm believer in giving someone a fair chance first by politely asking them to turn it down. A lot of times people honestly don't think they are disturbing others and are more than willing to oblige if you ask. And then there won't be any animosity between them and you for calling the police on them. I know I would absolutely turn it down if asked and would certainly appreciate it if they gave me the courtesy of asking me first. The last thing I want is to disturb others.

Ask your neighbours to stop first and explain why - trying to get to sleep/study etc. Are they the house owner? If not, complain to the landlord or the council. Playing loud music isn’t an offence unless dealt with as antisocial behaviour. You need a lot of evidence and it may take a while. Keep a diary of events - days/dates/times/what happened.
